extractedText: Blog AI in Retail Retail AI Adoption in the US: Trends, Use Cases and Opportunities AI is changing how retail operates in the U.S. It is improving customer experiences and increasing profits. Major companies like Walmart and Amazon are setting the example. Retailers are now investing in smarter strategies that use data to better meet customer needs. By: Amrita Jaswal 10 October 2025 Table of Contents More than 80% of large US retailers plan to increase their investment in AI, while many are aiming to deploy the technology across return management, customer service, and product availability monitoring. In fact, popular brands like Walmart are experimenting with “AI super agents” to personalize their customer interactions, streamline inventory decisions, and even automate restocking. With such strong competition around, retail leaders in the US need to use AI to stay competitive. Consumers want faster, smarter, and smoother shopping experiences, whether online or in-store. This blog dives into all the information about AI in retail and e-commerce. What trends are transforming AI adoption in US retail, which real use cases are delivering value today, what obstacles are getting in the way, and where the biggest opportunities lie. Generate Key Takeaways Generating... More than 55% of retailers report over 10% ROI from AI initiatives, proving its real business impact beyond experimentation. Walmart and Amazon use AI for tasks like predicting inventory needs, personalizing shopping, and providing real-time help, setting high standards for retail innovation. US shoppers now expect features like voice search, personalized discounts, and augmented reality try-ons, which are changing how brands connect with customers and build loyalty. Challenges associated with AI adoption include high implementation costs, poor data quality, and a shortage of skilled workers. However, strong partnerships and scalable AI solutions in retail and e-commerce can effectively overcome these challenges. Retail AI adoption in the US Retailers that use AI in their operations are gaining a competitive edge. Nearly half of CEOs believe that generative AI will boost profits within the next year, contributing to overall business growth. AI has become essential for changing how businesses operate and can help reduce costs . Those who don't adapt may fall behind in an economy driven by AI. The global market for artificial intelligence (AI) in retail is expected to grow significantly and reach about USD 17.76 billion by 2032. In 2023, North America held the largest share of the market at 39.08%. Source A US study found that retailers using AI experienced a 2.3 times increase in sales and a 2.5 times increase in profits compared to those not using AI. With this, AI becomes crucial for meeting personalized shopping needs and boosting efficiency and growth in the retail sector. How AI Shopping and Consumer Behavior are Helping Retailers in the USA? AI has significantly impacted customers' shopping behavior. When it comes to the US alone, the following ways show how it is helping the US retailers. Improving Customer Engagement and Loyalty Consumers prefer brands that remember their preferences. AI enables the delivery of personalized discounts, messages, and offers to specific customer segments. This boosts customer loyalty through personalized marketing, delivers customer satisfaction, and encourages repeat purchases. Meeting Customer Expectations AI features like voice search, product suggestions, and real-time support are now expected in shopping. Consumers see these options as part of a smooth and modern shopping experience, and even retailers in the US are already using them. Impulse Purchases in Retail AI-powered customer experience and recommendations based on your browsing history and preferences can lead to spontaneous buying decisions. Even, personalized product feeds work like digital suggestion windows that encourage consumers to check out faster. Generational Shopping Trends Millennials and Gen Z shoppers highly value convenience powered by AI. They appreciate features like AR try-ons and easy one-click purchases. These younger consumers prefer brands that focus on innovation and personalizing their shopping experience. Millennials and Gen Z especially favor popular brands like Amazon, that use AI for personalization and convenience. Bridge the Gap Between Innovation and Implementation Overcome the common barriers of cost, talent, and scalability with expert support. Partner with AI Specialists Today Current Applications of Retail AI Adoption in the US Adopting AI in the retail business may seem challenging. But advancements in digital technology, AI, and machine learning in retail operations are making these tools increasingly accessible.
